nodes.bodyText: You shouldn't need com.google.code.findbugs:jsr305 in the bannedDependency includes. This particular entry was removed from this file as part of the same PR that fixed in the inheritance.
Sure @JimSuplizio - will get rid of it from bannedDependencies includes.

I noticed that one or two files were moved and that in the remove their names were changed from CosmosDB* to CosmosDb*. I am wondering if it makes sense to change the name of the next two files from CosmosDB* to Cosmos*.
Yeah, good thought. I am trying to find consistency here - would like to change them to Cosmos* because of our new branding.
thank you for using UnsupportedOperationException rather than NotImplementedException as this reproduces our dependency on commons.
Yes, that was my exact intention behind this change. :)
I think the brand name is Cosmos not CosmosDB.
Yes, I am pushing an update for these. thanks.

is this a public class? I wonder if it should be CosmosDBFactory or CosmosFactory. the same comment applies to all other public surface area, should we go with CosmosDB or Cosmos on the public surface.
our brand name is Cosmos
Yes, changing all CosmosDB to Cosmos in next commit on this PR.
